message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you a fantastic product that I think you'll love. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I'm looking to sell. Would you be interested in making an offer for it?
I'm interested in the product, but $200 is a bit out of my budget. Would you be willing to consider a lower price?
I understand that $150 is a bit tight for you, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can offer you a discount, but I need to make a profit, so I'm thinking of a price of $180. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but $180 is still a bit out of my budget. I'm looking to get the best deal possible. Would you be willing to consider a lower price?
I'm willing to make another concession, but I need to make sure I'm getting a fair price for the product. I can do $170, but that's as low as I'm willing to go. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but $170 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, so I'll offer $165. Can you consider this price?

I'm starting to think we're getting close to a deal, Bob. I can see you're making a serious offer, and I appreciate that. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I need to make a bit more than $165. How about we meet at $168?

I appreciate your persistence, Alice. I'm getting close to my budget, but I still think we can do better. I'm willing to meet you at $165, but I'm not willing to go any higher than that. Can you consider this price?

I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob, but I've already met you at $168 and you rejected it. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to make sure I'm getting a fair price. How about we meet at $169?
